content.title: Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena
content.details: Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena, or Andhra Pradesh Overseas Study Scholarship, is a scholarship scheme launched on 11.07.2022 by the Government of Andhra Pradesh, Social Welfare Department for providing financial assistance to eligible students of Andhra Pradesh state for studying in overseas universities. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to eligible students belonging to SC/ST/BC/Minority/EBC including Kapu students to pursue PG/Ph.D/MBBS courses in the academic year 2023-2024 in any one of the 21 broad categories of subjects in top 50 Institutions/Universities.
benefits: 100% of the tuition fee for admission in top 100 Institutions/Universities
50% of tuition fee or ₹ 5,00,000 for admission in Institutions/Universities ranked 101 to 200
One-way Economy Class Tickets for the shortest route upon production of valid visa
Total Visa Fees reimbursement upon production of a valid visa and receipt of visa fee payment
eligibility: Candidates should be natives of A.P.
Maximum age should not exceed 35 years as of the date of publication of notification.
Family income shall not exceed ₹ 8,00,000/- per annum.
Only one candidate per family is eligible.
Candidates who availed financial assistance under similar schemes from the State or Govt of India are not eligible.
exclusions: The applicant who has already availed financial assistance under similar schemes from the State or from the Govt. of India is not eligible.
documents_required: Caste Certificate from the concerned Village/Ward Secretariat.
Income Certificate from the concerned Village/Ward Secretariat and physically certified by the concerned District Collector.
Ration Card of the Family of the Student, if available.
Nativity Certificate from the MeeSeva/Revenue Department.
Unconditional Offer Letter from Foreign University.
NEET Score Card, in case of admission into MBBS Course.
Copy of the latest Tax Returns of Family Members, wherever applicable.
Nationalized Bank Account Details of Student.
Self-Certification from the student that no other member of his family availed financial assistance under a similar scheme.

faqs.question: When Was The 'Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena' Scheme Launched?
faqs.answer: The 'Jagananna Videshi Vidya Deevena' scheme was launched on 11th July 2022 by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: What Is The Objective Of This Scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in the tuition fees to eligible students from low-income families, who have secured admission into any of the top 200 universities.

faqs.question: Are Residents Of Telangana Also Eligible To Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only the residents of Andhra Pradesh are eligible to apply for this scheme.

faqs.question: How Much Shall Be The Percentage Of Financial Assistance If The Student Secures Admission In The Top 100 Institutions/Universities?
faqs.answer: The selected candidates, whose admission is in the top 100 Institutions/Universities, shall be eligible for financial assistance of 100% of the tuition fee.

faqs.question: How Can The Selected Candidate Check The Payment Status?
faqs.answer: To check the Payment Status, visit the Official Website of YSR Navasakam and follow the instructions provided.
